Calculator¶

Source code for Calculator by RunySoft

calculator.Addition(a, b)[source]¶

Mathematical Addition: Adds viariables a and b.

Returns

retVal - value of this operation

  • Special Cases:

    n/a

  • Example:

    Addition(1,0)

  • Expected Success Response:

    1
calculator.Division(a, b)[source]¶

Mathematical Division: Divides variables a and b

Returns

retVal - value of this operation.

  • Special Cases:

    Division(a,0); a is from (-inf,+inf) -- Returns +infinity
Division(0,0); -- Returns NaN

  • Example:

    Division(4,2)

  • Expected Success Response:

    2
calculator.Exponentiation(a, b)[source]¶

Mathematical Exponentiation: Calculates the value of a to the power of b

Returns

retVal - value of this operation

  • Special Cases:

    Exponentiation(a,0); a is from (-inf,+inf) -- Returns 1

  • Example:

    Exponentiation(2,1)

  • Expected Success Response:

    2
calculator.Factorial(a)[source]¶

Mathematical Factiorial: Calculates the value of a!

Returns

retVal - value of this operation

  • Special Cases:

    Factorial(0) -- **Returns:**  1

  • Example:

    Factorial(2)

  • Expected Suceess Response:

    2
calculator.Log(a, b)[source]¶

Mathematical Logarithm: Calculates the value of logarithm of b to base a

Returns

retVal - value of this operaton

  • Special Cases:

    Log(a,1); a is from (0,+inf) -- Returns 0
Log(a,b); a is from (-inf,0> or b is from (-inf,0> -- Returns None

  • Example:

    Log(10,10)

  • Expected Success Result:

    1
calculator.Multiplication(a, b)[source]¶

Mathematical Muliplication: Multiplies varibles a and b

Returns

retVal - value of this operation

  • Special Cases:

    n/a

  • Example:

    Multiplication(2,2)

  • Expected Success Response:

    4

retVal - value of this operation

  • Special Cases:

    n/a

  • Example:

    Root(8,3)

  • Expected Success Result:

    2

retVal - value of this operation

  • Example:
